sentences.en: And, withal, a life of privation , isolation , abnegation chastity, with never a diversion.
sentences.cn: 同时, 他一生刻苦 、 独居克己 、 制欲, 从来不曾娱乐过.

sentences.en: Cold is the privation of heat.
He looked upon privation as no hardship.
sentences.cn: 他不把忍饥受冻当作什么苦难.
无知是一种纯粹的贫乏.

sentences.en: It will be the greatest imaginable privation for her to have to leave london.
sentences.cn: 对她来说,不得不离开伦敦大概是能想像到的最大的损失.

sentences.en: Privation of the company of all other human beings is a serious hardship.
sentences.cn: 丧失和他人交往的机会是一件很难受的事情.
战时生活必需品的匮乏

sentences.en: Then came a long period of bodily privation, of daily hunger after food.
sentences.cn: 接着,身体上又受到了长期的煎熬, 每天挨着饥饿.

sentences.en: They could have found a certain happiness in helping each other's privation.
sentences.cn: 他们在彼此互助,分担患难中,还找得到一种快乐.

sentences.en: Today he is seen as a saviour by millions of Filipinos living in privation.
sentences.cn: 而今,帕奎奥成了数百万菲律宾穷人的救世主.

sentences.en: What did hardship matter , privation, and disappointment , if he arrived at last?
sentences.cn: 一旦达到了目的,那么艰辛贫困和失意又算什么 呢 ?

words.tran_cn: 贫困；丧失；被剥夺了某物的状态

trans.tran_en: a lack or loss of the things that everyone needs, such as food, warmth, and shelter
